span.strong: HCCS-PS will be having its lottery today, Wednesday, April 15 at 1:00pm
Due to the unfortunate trying times of the COVID-19 crisis, the HCCS lottery will be held via ZOOM.
To view the HCCS lottery, please use this ZOOM link:

Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we have extended our application deadline and lottery date to give families who have been affected by COVID-19 a chance to submit an application. The new dates and timeline are as follows:
April 8, 2020, 5pm: APPLICATION DEADLINE for grades Pre-k - 8
April 15, 2020 1:00pm: Lottery via ZOOM (ZOOM link will be posted the day of the lottery)
April 16, 2020: Families will begin to receive notifications of their lottery status.
After April 15, 2020, families may continue to apply to HCCS's waitlist and will be contacted should a seat become available.
Applications are available on our website:
Mail application to: 646 5th Avenue, Brooklyn, NY 11215
Should you have any questions please call (718) 499-0957 and press 1.

p.span: Effective tomorrow, Monday, March 16th, HCCS-PS & HCCS-SI are closed until May 15th.
Our thoughts, concerns, and hearts are with our HCCS community during this challenging time.
If you have any questions or concerns, please contact the main office at 718.499.0957.

div.p: Dear HCCS Families,
The NYC DOE has extended the deadline for the submission of the Parent Environment Surveys to June 26th.
If you have already completed your parent survey, we thank you so much! If you have not done so, we are kindly asking you to please do so by
div.div: clicking on this link and completing your survey: nycschoolsurvey.org
If you have any questions, please contact our Director of Family & Community Engagement, Dena Capetanakis at dcapetanakis@hccs-nys.org

div.aria-label: Hellenic Classical Charter School - Park Slope (HCCS-PS) recognized as National Blue Ribbon School.

h2.span: Hellenic Classical Charter School - Park Slope (HCCS-PS) recognized as National Blue Ribbon School.

p.span: The Hellenic Classical Charter School Park Slope is being recognized as a National Blue Ribbon School. We are one of 19 schools from New York State to be recognized and one of the 362 schools nationwide. The recognition is based on our school's overall academic performance. The coveted National Blue Ribbon Schools award affirms the hard work of educators, families and communities in creating safe and welcoming schools where students master challenging and engaging content.

Please note, individuals who wish to have speaking time or to place an item on the agenda, must submit their request, in writing, no later than forty-eight (48) hours prior to the meeting, or Monday, April 28th , 2020 at 5:00pm respectively for each meeting. Requests should be submitted to the school office.
Materials that will be reviewed by the school board and subject to vote and/or adoption are available before the meeting in the school office.

Congratulations to our school for earning the distinction of being a RECOGNITION SCHOOL! This award was earned for the Hellenic Classical Charter School’s high achievement, growth and graduation rate! We are happy to be one of the best schools in New York State leading toward the accomplishment of educational excellence in student performance.

div.aria-label: February 2020 - HCCS Ancient Greek Theatre and History Day Fair teams travel to Greece on research expedition!

h2.span: February 2020 - HCCS Ancient Greek Theatre and History Day Fair teams travel to Greece on research expedition!

div.p: Day 1 - arrival and first night in Athens - dinner at traditional taverna.
First night in Athens - dinner at traditional taverna.
First night in Athens - dinner at traditional taverna.
Students dancing and enjoying the live music.
Group photo of the kids
Day 2 - Acropolis, Parthenon & Acropolis Museum
Team HCCS Team - 40 faculty, students and families!
Day 2 - Acropolis, Parthenon & Acropolis Museum
HDF Team
Day 2 - Acropolis, Parthenon & Acropolis Museum
AGT Team
The Porch of the Caryatids
Ancient Theater
Ancient Agora
HCCS with private tour guide Margarita visiting the Acropolis Museum
Acropolis Museum
The AGT team and Caryatids, missing one sister.
The HDF team and the Caryatids, missing one sister.

Day 3 - the HDF team visited Ancient Olympia where the very first Olympics took place in 776 BC! They also had a personal tour of The Archaeological Museum of Olympia. The students got to compete in a race of their own where Sebastian was deemed victor with a olive crown, just like in ancient times!
HCCS students got to compete in a race of their own.
Sebastian was deemed victor with a olive crown, just like in ancient times!
Day 3 - AGT's first stop - The Corinth Canal and the ancient ruins of Corinth.
The Corinth Canal
Stop 2 - AGT visited the fascinating Ancient Theatre of Epidaurus, a 4th century monument with the most incredible acoustics.
Stop 3 - Tour of Ancient Mycenae to see the Lion Gates and the Treasury of Atreus.
Pit stop for lunch in the beautiful seaport city of Nafplio

Last stop - The Panathenaic Stadium or Kallimarmaro is a multi-purpose stadium in Athens, Greece. One of the main historic attractions of Athens, it is the only stadium in the world built entirely of marble.

Day 4 - AGT visited Delphi, an ancient Greek religious sanctuary sacred to the god Apollo, one of greek mythology’s important gods. Located on Mt. Parnassus near the Gulf of Corinth, the sanctuary was home to the famous oracle of Apollo which gave cryptic predictions and guidance to both city, states and individuals and is also considered to be the center of the world!
The Center of the World - the Omphalos aka the Navel of the World, a mythological center of the world or universe.
Lunch in the beautiful nothern ski village of Arachova.

Day 4 - NHD students visited the Archaeological Museum of Marathon today, viewing the burial place of Greek warriors who fell in the famous Battle of Marathon, defending Athenian civilization from Persian conquest in 490 B. C.

HDF visited the Gennadius Library at the American School of Classical Studies in Athens where reviewed great resources on the modern Olympics of 1896 and the mid-Olympics of 1906 in Athens in the Scrapbooks of John Gennadius. They also were given a lecture by Director Jenifer Neils on Ancient Greek female athletics including the Heraia.
Departure day - it was a world wind trip!

div.span: Hellenic Classical Charter School - Park Slope & Staten Island

div.p: Dear HCCS Families,

It is with great pleasure and excitement that I welcome you and your children to the 2019-2020 school year. If you are new to our school, I would like to welcome you to the greatest school in the world!

I am proud to announce that for the fifth year in a row The New York State Education Department has identified HCCS-PS as a “Reward School”. A Reward School is a school that has made the most progress and/or a school that has the highest achievement in the state without significant gaps in student achievement between subgroups. Congratulations to our entire amazing HCCS family for achieving this recognition!
We are very excited about the opening of HCCS-SI and look forward to making more students life long learners!

Our goal is to bring our students to the level of college and career ready. I encourage all our families to log on to the web site engageny.org. On this web site you will find a parent and family section that not only informs you of the new initiatives but also includes educational activities you can do with your children that are related to the Common Core Standards. You will also find guides to the standards, as well as videos and information on how to interpret the standards and the recent state test results and score reports.

We are planning a year filled with engaging standards-based work in our beautiful new school building. Many new initiatives will be announced in later weeks such as our recent notification that we are once again accepted into The Carnegie Hall Musical Explorers, The NYC Ballet Nutcracker Program, the middle school STEM initiative entitled, Urban Advantage, and many more. Our school calendar, including upcoming events and celebrations will posted on our school web site and emailed to you.
Please do not hesitate to call us should you ever have any questions. Together we will provide an extraordinary learning environment and education for our children.
Sincerely,
Christina Tettonis
Superintendent
HCCS Ancient Greek Theater and History Day Fair in Greece!
HCCS partnered with Lego Discovery and hosted the Brooklyn Bridge replica as part of our school's STEM fair.
HCCS students celebrating Greek Independence Day.

div.aria-label: The HCCS Class of 2019 and their High Schools

h2.span: The HCCS Class of 2019 and their High Schools

div.p: CONGRATULATIONS to our 8th Graders!

p.strong: 15% of our 8th graders were offered admission to a Specialized High School

ul.li: Brooklyn High School of the Arts
City Polytechnic HS of Engineering, Architecture and Technology
Midwood Liberal Arts and Science Institute
Urban Assembly New York Harbor School
Williamsburg HS of Architecture and Design

p.strong: * As of date, our students have also received over $413,600 in scholarships for Catholic High Schools.

div.aria-label: HCCS named High Achieving and High Progress Schools as Reward Schools in New York State

h2.span: HCCS named High Achieving and High Progress Schools as Reward Schools in New York State

div.p: The Hellenic Classical Charter School was named as 1 of the 155 high performing schools in New York State. We are proud of the accomplishments of our students, and teachers. Hellenic is truly an exemplar school.

p.strong: To read more about this wonderful news, please follow the link below to the New York State Education Department's web site:

div.aria-label: HCCS featured in the book "The Best Elementary Schools in New York City".

h2.span: HCCS featured in the book "The Best Elementary Schools in New York City".

p.br: HCCS is featured in the book New York City's Best Public Elementary Schools: A Parent's Guide 4th Edition.

p.em: "HCCS is a winning, spirited school where kids are motivated to participate wholeheartedly. Children study the world through the rich lens of Greek language and culture..."

div.aria-label: HCCS congratulates Faye Michalakos - recipient of the NYC DOE Big Apple Award Teacher.

h2.span: HCCS congratulates Faye Michalakos - recipient of the NYC DOE Big Apple Award Teacher.

div.p: Faye Michalakos, a veteran teacher at HCCS, was awarded the NYC DOE Big Apple Award Teacher by NYC Chancellor Carmen Farina.

The Big Apple Awards is a citywide recognition program that celebrates the educators of New York City who inspire students, model great teaching, and enrich their school communities. By honoring the success of these teachers, the NYC Department of Education recognizes the countless teachers who go above and beyond to serve our students and families.
Congratulations to Faye and our entire staff of amazing teachers.

div.h2: To access the New York City Department of Education, kindly click on the link below.
